main event: A circular or disc-shaped object was observed over the San Jacinto Mountains near Palm Springs, California on June 26, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared to shimmer and was the size of a quarter when viewed through binoculars.
The object appeared in the west and disappeared in the west, veering at high speed to the west just prior to disappearance.
The object was observed at an estimated 20,000 yards over the San Jacinto Mountains.
Prior to disappearance, the object seemed to be riding a thermal and was noted to 'shimmer or waver'.
